result.execSummary:
The defendant Heidi S Kirmse was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: Bond amount posted shall be applied.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Def in person & by Atty Jeffrey A. Jaeger.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Victim and counseling also appear.  Guilty plea entered to Count 2, Court dismissed Count 1 for read-in.  Court finds def guilty on Count 2 and enters judgment.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def in person & by Atty Jeffrey A. Jaeger.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper & Atty Samuel Tufford appeared for State.  Counsel's first appearance.  Defense moves to amend bond.  Court will not address bond modification unless victim is present.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
